intro: Philippia viscosa, commonly known as the roughleaf philippia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its woody stems, opposite leaves with serrated edges, and small, clustered white or pink flowers. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in shaded, moist environments. Philippia viscosa is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and fragrant blooms.
